intro: Cineraria lobata, commonly known as the woolly cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice among gardeners.
